scenarios.title: Week 0: Birth Record + Parent Profile
scenarios.context: Choose one transparent context bundle (we use these to seed the six variables—none is 'better').
scenarios.precommitPrompt: What strength do you predict will matter most in your family's first six months?

options.label: Community‑rooted newcomers (shift work; strong kin)
options.mechanism: Lower income + irregular hours tighten time/money; kin density boosts support.

options.label: Dual‑career urban professionals (flex jobs; limited kin nearby)
options.mechanism: High earnings with time scarcity; thinner day‑to‑day support.

options.label: Rural gig‑economy (unstable income; strong community)
options.mechanism: Income volatility adds stress; place‑based ties add practical support.

scenarios.title: Week 0: Image-of-the-Child self-audit
scenarios.context: Name the frame you bring into parenting; it will colour early interpretations.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Which frame best describes your starting stance? Why might it change?

options.label: Agentic/competent child view
options.mechanism: Assumes capability; increases shared problem-solving.

options.label: Fragile/vulnerable child view
options.mechanism: Caution rises; can increase vigilance and stress.

scenarios.title: Week 1: Feeding Method
scenarios.context: You weigh breastfeeding, formula, or a combination while preparing return‑to‑work plans.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Which determinant (time, money, support, norms) will most constrain this decision?

options.label: Exclusively breastfeed
options.mechanism: Time‑intensive; can soothe infant; support may dip due to scrutiny or fatigue.

options.label: Exclusively formula
options.mechanism: Cost rises; caregiving shareable; some perceive more support via shared feeding.

options.label: Combination feeding
options.mechanism: Shared caregiving + flexibility; modest costs/time; relationship supported.

scenarios.title: Week 1: Return-to-work plan
scenarios.context: Parental leave is ending. Choose a care plan that fits your context.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: What will be the bottleneck (time, money, support)?

options.label: Shift-share with partner + neighbour swap
options.mechanism: Complex coordination but deepens support.

options.label: Enroll in centre-based care
options.mechanism: Reliable schedule; cost and child adjustment period.

options.label: Extend leave (unpaid)
options.mechanism: Time increases; income drops.

scenarios.title: Week 2: Sleep Strategy
scenarios.context: Night wakings surge. You must balance co‑regulation with restoring adult sleep.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Which variable will change most from your choice and why?

options.label: Formal sleep training (graduated)
options.mechanism: Faster adult sleep recovery; short‑term child dysregulation rises; parent stress falls.

options.label: No‑cry + parent shifts
options.mechanism: Shared load preserves co‑regulation; time cost; relationship/support benefit.

options.label: Bring baby into bed
options.mechanism: Eases infant distress; mixed public norms may reduce perceived support.

scenarios.title: Week 2b: Equity Intervention Card (one‑time)
scenarios.context: You may play ONE card to soften an early constraint. Choose wisely.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Which trade‑off are you willing to accept, and why?

options.label: Community subsidy (program + workshops)
options.mechanism: Paperwork + workshops cost time; boosts money/support.

options.label: Flexible work arrangement
options.mechanism: Time expands; earnings dip; stress may rise from changes.

options.label: Parental mental‑health grant
options.mechanism: Appointments cost time/money; large stress relief over term.

options.label: Relocate near extended family
options.mechanism: Transitions strain child/relationship; support net deepens.

scenarios.title: Week 3: Challenging Theorists & Research Methods — Responding to Elder’s Critique
scenarios.context: A family elder publicly critiques your feeding choice as ‘unhealthy’.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: What evidence or lens will you lean on (methods, culture, lived authority)?

options.label: Advocate respectfully with evidence
options.mechanism: Takes time; relational respect can grow; stress from confrontation.

options.label: Let it pass (no engagement)
options.mechanism: Saves time; may cool perceived support/relationship.

options.label: Seek quiet allies
options.mechanism: Builds a supportive micro‑network; time cost.

scenarios.title: Week 3: Research methods in the wild
scenarios.context: A blog cites a 'study' to justify a parenting rule.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: What will you scrutinize first?

options.label: Check design and sample (WEIRD?)
options.mechanism: Better filter reduces anxiety; time to read.

options.label: Ignore (too busy)
options.mechanism: Saves time; no literacy gain.

options.label: Appeal to authority (influencer)
options.mechanism: Unstable evidence can raise stress.

scenarios.title: Week 4: Social‑Emotional Dev. — Public tantrum
scenarios.context: Your preschooler melts down at a grocery store.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Name one macrosystem factor that shapes bystander reactions.

options.label: Step outside to co‑regulate
options.mechanism: Model co‑regulation; immediate time cost; stronger bond.

options.label: Co‑regulate in place
options.mechanism: Takes longer; lowers child distress; public scrutiny hurts support.

options.label: Ignore and finish quickly
options.mechanism: Saves time; stress and relationship strain rise.

scenarios.title: Week 4: Home emotion-coaching routine
scenarios.context: After the public tantrum, you plan a home routine.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Which element will you prioritise first?

options.label: Predictable routine + visuals
options.mechanism: Structure reduces dysregulation.

options.label: Set up a 'care circle' text thread
options.mechanism: Increases perceived and practical support.

options.label: Handle it solo for now
options.mechanism: Maintains privacy; increases load.

scenarios.title: Week 5a: Socialization — Risk‑play ban at daycare
scenarios.context: Daycare bans ‘risky play’. You consider next steps.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Which system (micro→macro) is the main lever here?

options.label: Advocate for policy revision
options.mechanism: Time‑heavy; improves support/child regulation via better play.

options.label: Comply + supplement at home
options.mechanism: Moderate time; protects relationship; limited systemic change.

options.label: Withdraw & re‑enrol in forest program
options.mechanism: Costly; improves child experience; admin stress up.

scenarios.title: Week 5: Equity card — second chance
scenarios.context: If you did not use your Equity Card earlier, you may play ONE now. If already used, choose 'Already used'.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: If you play it now, which constraint are you bending and why?

options.label: Play card: Community subsidy
options.mechanism: Paperwork time; increases money/support.

options.label: Play card: Flexible work
options.mechanism: More time with some stress and earnings hit.

options.label: Play card: Parental MH grant
options.mechanism: Appointments cost time/money; stress relief later.

options.label: Play card: Relocate near family
options.mechanism: Transitions strain but support deepens.

options.label: Already used (no change)
options.mechanism: No effect.

scenarios.title: Week 5b: Early media rules (preschool/early school)
scenarios.context: Screens are creeping up — think tablets/TV/YouTube Kids. Set early habits; Discord comes later when the child is older.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: What principle guides your early media habits (restriction, scheduling, co-created family rules)?

options.label: Open dialogue + co‑create rules
options.mechanism: Trust‑building reduces conflict; some time cost.

options.label: Restrictive settings
options.mechanism: Lower conflict now; risks secrecy later.

options.label: Scheduled tech time
options.mechanism: Predictability helps routines; light time cost.

scenarios.title: Week 6: External Influences — Peer value conflict
scenarios.context: Grade 2–4 peer brings home values you strongly oppose. You want to keep trust while setting boundaries.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: What outcome do you fear most? Why?

options.label: Restrict interaction
options.mechanism: Short‑term relief; child agency and trust may dip.

options.label: Guided discussion + media literacy
options.mechanism: Coached critical thinking strengthens bond; small time cost.

options.label: Exposure to diverse views
options.mechanism: Broadened contexts; heavier time lift.

scenarios.title: Week 6: School alignment note
scenarios.context: You consider emailing the teacher about the peer-value conflict.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: What tone do you choose?

options.label: Collaborative, curiosity-first
options.mechanism: Builds alliance; small time cost.

options.label: Directive (request restrictions)
options.mechanism: May strain alliance; faster.

options.label: No email
options.mechanism: Saves time; loses chance to align.

scenarios.title: Week 7: Disability & Mental Health — Assessment pathway
scenarios.context: Teacher flags attention/learning concerns.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Which barrier matters most here (waitlists, stigma, cost, time)?

options.label: Meet with teacher & support team
options.mechanism: Alliance and plan reduce uncertainty; some costs/time.

options.label: Private exploration (observe; resources)
options.mechanism: Faster info if affordable; neutral support.

options.label: Watch and wait
options.mechanism: Saves time now; stress/support risks later.

options.label: Consult a culturally aligned clinician/elder + teacher triad
options.mechanism: Shared cultural frame reduces stigma and improves alliance; small costs and coordination time.

scenarios.title: Week 7: Disclosure plan
scenarios.context: You decide whether to disclose the assessment plan to your community.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: What matters most for your family here?

options.label: Selective disclosure to trusted adults
options.mechanism: Gains targeted support; some time/coordination.

options.label: Open disclosure (class WhatsApp)
options.mechanism: Wider net with risk to child comfort.

options.label: Keep it private
options.mechanism: Protects privacy; reduces potential support.

scenarios.title: Week 8: Family Resource Management — Vehicle breakdown
scenarios.context: Car needs $1,500 in repairs right before a planned family trip.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Which resource will you sacrifice first?

options.label: Dip into savings
options.mechanism: Money down; stability preserved.

options.label: Take a high‑interest loan
options.mechanism: Spreads cost but adds stress from debt.

options.label: Cancel holiday plans
options.mechanism: Saves money/time; strains relationship/child expectations.

scenarios.title: Week 8: Budget triage after car repair
scenarios.context: You must rebalance the monthly budget.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Which lever will you pull first?

options.label: Cut discretionary spending
options.mechanism: Saves cash; possible conflict over cuts.

options.label: Take extra shifts
options.mechanism: More money; less time; stress up.

options.label: Ask kin for short-term loan
options.mechanism: Relief via social capital; costs time to coordinate.

scenarios.title: Week 9: Risk & Resilience — Natural‑disaster decision
scenarios.context: A wildfire approaches. You must decide quickly.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Name one protective factor you already built earlier.

options.label: Evacuate to friends/family
options.mechanism: Social capital buffers stress/costs.

options.label: Red Cross centre
options.mechanism: Stable basics; crowding strains child/relationship.

options.label: Shelter in place
options.mechanism: Risk escalates; stress/relationship hit.

scenarios.title: Week 9: Evacuation communication plan
scenarios.context: Smoke persists. You plan communication protocols with your teen.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: What’s the priority?

options.label: Define roles and check-in times
options.mechanism: Predictability lowers stress.

options.label: Buy backup battery + data plan
options.mechanism: Costs money; improves resilience.

options.label: Informal ‘text me when’
options.mechanism: Low effort; variable reliability.

scenarios.title: Week 10: Knowledge Mobilisation + Adolescent Autonomy — Belonging/identity rift
scenarios.context: Teen explores an identity you don’t share; tension rises around cultural practices.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Which kind of autonomy (emotional/behavioural/value) is at stake?

options.label: Open dialogue (listen first)
options.mechanism: Perspective‑taking repairs trust.

options.label: Set expectations/non‑negotiables
options.mechanism: Clarity reduces your stress; risks distance.

options.label: Cultural bridge gesture
options.mechanism: Signals respect via action; small costs.

scenarios.title: Week 10: Knowledge mobilization output
scenarios.context: You choose how to translate what you’ve learned for a real audience.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Who needs this message most?

options.label: Plain-language letter to a policymaker
options.mechanism: Civic channel; boosts agency.

options.label: Workshop with school community
options.mechanism: Builds mesosystem ties; time cost.

options.label: Community thread / infographic
options.mechanism: Shares knowledge broadly without meeting logistics.

scenarios.title: Week 10b: Teen online communities (Discord/YouTube)
scenarios.context: Your teen wants to join Discord servers and run a YouTube channel. You need boundaries that preserve trust and safety.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: Which risk are you most concerned about (privacy, time-sink, content), and which protective factor can you build?

options.label: Co-create server/channel rules + shared norms (periodic joint reviews)
options.mechanism: Autonomy-supportive boundaries strengthen trust; regular check-ins reduce conflict.

options.label: Install monitoring + hard time locks
options.mechanism: External controls lower your uncertainty but risk secrecy and relational strain.

options.label: Open trust + post-hoc debriefs (no pre-emptive controls)
options.mechanism: Signals respect; relies on existing trust; uneven protection if conflicts arise.

scenarios.title: Week 11: Parent–Adult transition — Move‑out decision
scenarios.context: Young adult considers moving out amid high costs.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: What principle guides you here (autonomy, security, culture, equity)?

options.label: Push independence (limited support)
options.mechanism: Saves your resources; strains bond.

options.label: Co‑plan launch with safety net
options.mechanism: Shared planning boosts relationship; modest costs.

options.label: Maintain nest (stay longer)
options.mechanism: Buffers risk; costs money/time; can delay autonomy.

scenarios.title: Week 11: Launch support plan
scenarios.context: Alongside the move-out decision, you set a support structure.
scenarios.precommitPrompt: What’s your safety net?

options.label: Co-sign + written budget
options.mechanism: Financial risk increases; clarity and support go up.

options.label: Seek microgrant/community bursary
options.mechanism: Paperwork time; reduces cost burden.

options.label: Encourage peer flatshare
options.mechanism: Distributes risk and support.
